alert.note: Alert for Caroline; Queen Anne's; Talbot (Maryland) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Philadelphia - Mount Holly (New Jersey, Delaware, Southeastern Pennsylvania)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 14 at 5:55PM EDT by NWS Philadelphia - Mount Holly
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of northeastern Talbot, south central Queen Anne`s and southern Caroline Counties through 630 PM EDT... At 555 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from Easton to near Hurlock to 8 miles southwest of Vienna. Movement was northeast at 30 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Easton, Denton, Federalsburg, Ridgely, Preston, Queen Anne, Tanyard, Harmony, Starr, Skipton, Jumptown, Agner, Matthews, Choptank, Griffin, Windyhill, Cordova, Hope and Hillsboro. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with these storms and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. These storms may intensify, so be certain to monitor local radio stations and available television stations for additional information and possible warnings from the National Weather Service.
